item.title: Genetic Intersections of Language and Neuropsychiatric Conditions
Whole-genome sequencing in a family with twin boys with autism and intellectual disability suggests multimodal polygenic risk
Forecasting autism gene discovery with machine learning and genome-scale data
Avoidant restrictive food intake disorder in autism
item.description: In this SPARK Research Match study, a survey of over a thousand families were asked about the eating habits of both parents and children. The first large scale study of its kind in the context of autism, it found that up to 22% of autisic children may be at risk for the under-diagnosed condition Avoidant Restrictive Food Intake Disorder (ARFID). Several risk factors for ARFID were also linked to restrictive and repetative behaviors.
